summary: My education and training as a researcher and visual artist, and a diverse skill set in administrative support and project management, have equipped me to work with people from all walks of life. I constantly look forward to collaborating with creatives, scientists and students. When in leadership positions, I like to create environments where individual thriving and collective growth are inseparable values, practiced through implementation of tangible organization structures, curriculum development, documentation/archiving and an active effort to respond to the growing contemporary challenges of our world. These multi-disciplinary educational and work experiences help me elicit imagination in problem solving and sustainably invigorate my mind.

education.degree_name: Het Diploma Staatsexamen Nederlands als tweede taal (Nt2)

school.name: Mahindra United World College of India

education.field_of_study: Economics, Global Politics, English Literature, Spanish, Mathematics & Biology

profile_positions.location: New York, New York, United States
profile_positions.description:
• Dancefilm and performance collaboration with Elena Demyanenko, Mariam Ghani, Eva Karczag, Laurel Jenkins, Chloë Engel and Finley Janes. Co-cameraperson and editor with India Abbott.
• Responsible for daily preparation of filming, sound recording and viewing equipment for smooth operation on set. Organizing evening reviews to assess footage goals and refine setup for low-light production.
• Communications lead and archivist for viewings at Middlebury College, VT and HERE Arts Center, NYC.
• Creating promotional materials for Facebook and Instagram.
﻿• Specific production experience: 4K multi-camera setup, low-lighting, prime lenses, gimbals, monitors.
profile_positions.title: Cameraperson

profile_positions.description:
• Admissions Counselor for the following states in the American South and Southwest: Utah, Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas and Louisiana.
• Connecting with STEM-focused high school students about research opportunities at Bennington College. Maintaining relationships with guidance counselors, scheduling yearly visits to priority schools and presenting at college fairs via extensive travel in the fall.
• Reviewing college applications (domestic and international) for admissions decisions.
• Co-managing a team of 26 student interns to organize consistent outreach events for prospective and admitted students to increase engagement and encourage enrollment. Leading interns to boost virtual content for the institution on major social media platforms (due to transition to remote learning in light of the COVID19 pandemic) such as Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Tumblr and ZeeMee.
• Creating a virtual tour for the college and a catalogue of 360° images of campus.
• Administrative Experience: coordinating inter-department communications in a fast-paced environment; planning travel, scheduling meetings, coordinating technical support, setting agendas, and taking notes for interactions within a complex network of 2000+ prospective students, guidance counselors, college professors and admissions staff; updating calendars, documents and relevant systems for long term projects and last-minute changes; managing extensive email outreach databases and handling a large volume of calls between international time zones.
• Specific production experience: 4K DSLR and iPhone set ups, supervising remote video editing workflows, 360° photography and videography.
profile_positions.title: Kilpatrick Fellow/Admissions Counselor

profile_positions.description:
• Assisted production and filming of a series of dance improvisations and set phrases between visual artist J Blackwell and dancer Elena Demyanenko. Used as props, Blackwell’s series of works titled Neveruses changed character on the performer’s body—from mask, to dress, to rain. My role as cameraperson was to capture this somatic exchange between subject and object.
• Specific production experience: low-light set up, 4K DSLR handheld filming.
profile_positions.title: Cameraperson

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for production, cinematography and editing of Four Emergent Forms: Visual Improvisation, (displayed at Galleri Tom Christoffersen in Copenhagen, Denmark) a collaboration between printmaker Thorsten Dennerline and dancers Susan Sgorbati, Emily Climer and Marie Lynn Haas exploring spontaneous composition of form in complex systems. 
• Specific production experience: 4K DSLR multi-camera set up.
profile_positions.title: Videographer

profile_positions.description:
• Facilitate establishment of 'Community Living Agreements', a set of guidelines generated collaboratively by the residents of a student house. 
• Cultivate a culture of mutual respect and understanding by facilitating discussions on residential life issues and student needs during weekly community meetings called 'Coffee Hour'.
• Plan and host weekly film screenings, game nights and concerts in collaboration with residents.
• First point of contact for residents. Distribute information and updates on academic and community resources for students. Offer peer emotional and mental support to residents, and refer them to counseling resources on campus. Mediate conflicts between residents.
• Meet with the Assistant Director of Residential Life to discuss housing issues, resident needs and planned programming. Represent student voice on administrative policies.
profile_positions.title: House Chair, Office of Student Life

profile_positions.description:
• Manage shifts of four to five Admissions Interns to facilitate the completion of weekly office goals.
• Lead personalized tours based on academic interests of prospective students. Write tour reports detailing students’ engagement during visits to support Admissions Counselors with decision-making.
• Maintain long-term correspondence with applicants via email or letters. Participating in phonathons during yield season of the yearly college admissions cycle.
• Produce original content for Tapped In, the official blog for the Admissions Office. Make bi-weekly posts on Instagram and Facebook highlighting the role of dining, housing and student organizations in building community on campus.
profile_positions.title: Admissions Intern & Shift Leader

profile_positions.description:
• Backup old web pages to local directories and create new web pages for the website migration project of http://bennington.edu/.
• Write, design and edit in small teams to produce content for prospective student engagement.
• Edit photographs and videos to reduce file sizes while preserving quality.
• Coordinate with developers to optimize website architecture, server configuration and page construction for search engine evaluation and optimizing visibility.
profile_positions.title: Communications Summer Intern

company.name: Arizona State University School of Social Transformation

profile_positions.company: Arizona State University School of Social Transformation
profile_positions.description:
• Train high school teachers to use G Suite for smooth execution of the CompuPower computer literacy curriculum.
• Research and design coding lessons for grades 9 to 12 using a combination of platforms such as CodePen and Zotero.
• Determine Internal Review Board requirements for high schools in the state of Arizona and New Mexico to assess eligibility for expansion of the CompuPower program in the Southwestern United States.
• Collect survey data, translate responses from Spanish to English and analyse results with respect to quarterly and annual student development goals. Redesign and migrate surveys to an online format to eliminate paper usage and centralize information storage.
• Using R, Gephi and Cytoscape to generate network visualization graphs for identifying potential strategic partnerships across STEAM+H departments, colleges and campuses of ASU and establish a live database of stakeholders invested in issues of gender equity.
• Pitch ideas for future collaborations, publications, video content and team training.
• Organize SPARKS sessions where Arizona high school students receive college guidance and mentorship from ASU undergraduates via remote online sessions and classroom visits.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern, Center for Gender Equity in Science and Technology

profile_positions.description:
• Working with the Gamma Ray Group under the supervision of Dr. David Kieda. Writing a Python and separate R program for secondary analysis of Stellar Intensity Interferometry (a technique for generating high-resolution images of surfaces of distant stars) observations from StarBase Observatory, Grantsville, Utah.
• Attending classes at the Center for High Performance Computing, University of Utah on NumPy and SciPy applications in astronomy research.
• Visualizing nightly data to generate graphics for research publications, conferences and posters. Presenting at the Research Experiences for Undergraduates Conference in Salt Lake City on the methods used for secondary data analysis and visualization, the future of SII and vision of the Gamma Ray Group.
profile_positions.title: Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Participant

company.name: Very Energetic Radiation Imaging Telescope Array System (VERITAS)

profile_positions.location: Fred Lawrence Whipple Observatory, Amado, Arizona
profile_positions.company: Very Energetic Radiation Imaging Telescope Array System (VERITAS)
profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for nightly setup, operation and closing of an array of four 12-meter optical reflectors for gamma-ray astronomy with an international team of astronomers and astrophysicists.
• Assessing sky conditions and shortlisting targets optimised with respect to priority and maximizing observation times.
• Conduct routine inspection of electronics and hardware for functional temperatures, humidities and power levels during observation hours. Troubleshoot errors in primary data processing to prevent loss of observational data.
• Assisting in-house repair and maintenance of generators and motors. Working on construction of a Schwarzschild-Couder telescope prototype for the Cherenkov Telescope Array.
• Guided by Dr. David Kieda from the University of Utah to examine correlations between soft, medium-energy and hard gamma-ray rates from Markarian 421, a blazar (a galaxy with an active central black hole spewing jets of material and energy). Used Python to parse data from text files in the observational archive and performed analysis. Generated data visualizations for using gnuplot.
profile_positions.title: Astronomy Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Nightly setup, operation and closing of a state-of-the-art, 24-inch research telescope at Vestal Street Observatory to continuously observe BY Cam, a binary star.
• Conduct analysis of the light period for the star system to provide evidence for its theorised cataclysmic asynchronous polar nature (a way of saying violent and energetic).
• Perform primary data analysis using MaxIm DL 5 and secondary data analysis using American Association of Variable Star Oberver’s VPhot & VStar.
• Facilitate public observing nights at Loines Observatory and Vestal Street Observatory.
profile_positions.title: Astronomy Intern

profile_positions.description:
• After-school tutor for science, math and social studies for at-risk youth in grades 9 to 12.
• Review class material with students by discussing readings, working solutions to problems and reviewing worksheets. Give feedback on essays and creative writing pieces and use positive reinforcement techniques to encourage, motivate and build confidence in students.
• Support students in charting individual academic and personal goals, including advising on local jobs and internships and post-secondary education.
• Provide guidance on scholarship programs at the University of Vermont, Southern Vermont College, Bennington College and low-cost higher education opportunities in Europe, specifically in France, Germany, Netherlands and Scandinavia.
• Confer with parents/guardians and teachers to discuss student progress, identify individual and group academic needs and determine curriculum priorities.
profile_positions.title: Classroom Tutor
